2/26/2025.name: Winter Choir Concert
2/26/2025.description:
This year's Winter Choir Concert highlights Black History and Black choral composers. Each group will feature music from gospel and spiritual traditions, as well as other pieces representing Jewish, Italian, Ladino, and Omani musical cultures. Come enjoy some outstanding singing from three of the best choirs around!

*  Streaming via Vimeo
2/26/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center

2/27/2025.name: Black History Month at SHS: Operation Black History Month
2/27/2025.description: Get ready to celebrate! DIVCO's Operation Black History Month, a collaboration between the  Black Student Union  and  Diversity Council , is bringing an exciting afternoon of Black culture and cuisine to life! Join us in room 2104 on Thursday, February 27th at 3:45 PM for a festive celebration filled with delicious food, vibrant music, and unforgettable fun. Don't miss out!

3/3/2025.description:
Galinsky has decades of experience as a researcher and consultant, and we appreciate his take on how leaders can be trained and nurtured to be inspiring. Great topics for the workplace, volunteering, and peer-to-peer contexts. Galinsky taught at NU's Kellogg School of Management 2007-12.

3/4/2025.name: Winter Band Concert
3/4/2025.description:
The Winter Band Concert will feature performances from all six of our curricular bands, offering a comprehensive look at the program's work. The program includes the  Freshman Band ,  Symphonic Band ,  Wind Symphon  y  and the  Wind Ensemble . These bands are directed by Caitlin McGovern, Mark Hiebert, and Ben Voigt. The concert will include a selection of music, from classic band repertoire to contemporary pieces.

This year's concert will also feature a guest performance by the John Hersey Symphonic Band. Additionally, our bands will have the opportunity to work with guest conductor Mr. Jeffrey Spenner from the United States Coast Guard Band.

The Winter Band Concert provides an opportunity to hear the results of the students' hard work and dedication. We invite you to attend and enjoy an evening of music.





 LINKS 


 *  DOWNLOAD: Event Program   
*  Streaming via Vimeo
3/4/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center

3/5/2025.name: CCC Presents: Career Ready Trade Expo
3/5/2025.description:
Stevenson High School's Career Ready, Trades, and Military Expo will take place on March 5th! This event is a great opportunity for students to explore careers that require little to no postsecondary education. It will be held in the Wood Commons, West Commons, and Upper Forum. During 8th period, the expo will be open to Stevenson students only with 8th period free, and from 4:00pm to 6:30pm, parents and families are welcome to attend.

This expo is designed for students interested in careers that offer on-the-job training, full-time employment opportunities with minimal degree requirements. Industry professionals, trade and apprenticeship programs, and military representatives will be available to discuss various career paths. Community college representatives will also be present to provide information about two-year degree programs.

Please check out the participant list ( drive.google.com/file/d/1OupZekG1bgGBFOrWytwlCe_t6VuDZRlR/view?usp=sharing ) to see which organizations are attending. A detailed event handout, including table locations and additional information, will be provided closer to the date.

If you have any questions, please contact Jaime Travis at  jtravis@d125.org .

3/5/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: What To Expect When Your Teen Turns 18
3/5/2025.description:
Many parents find it surprising that their parental rights change when their teen turns 18. During this discussion, Alan Press and Caren Naidoff, attorneys from the Shire Law Group, will discuss how parents can continue to support their teens when they become legal adults.

Due to the popularity of this topic, we will host a small group of in-person audience members who will have an opportunity to interact with Alan and Carin during their presentation. If you would like to attend the discussion at the Stevenson High School district office, please complete this form ( forms.gle/SBy55qCzjszfcCP16 )

Alternately, you are invited to participate in this discussion via Zoom:  zoom.us/j/93571206590

3/5/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: 99% Perspiration: A New Working History of the American Way of Life
3/5/2025.description:
Chandler's book explores what happens when hard work, grit, and ambition isn't enough to become successful. He traveled across the US interviewing teachers, civic leaders, elected offciials, faith leaders, blue collar workers, and entrepreneurs, and reaches the conclusion that it's a myth that success is a matter of individual ingenuity and bootstrapping. Self-reliance is laudable, but not in itself sufficient. Humans are an interdependent, relational species, and achievement has deep roots in connection with others.





 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/99-pers... 

  

  

  







  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/481740339...

3/6/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Shift: Managing Your Emotions - So They Don't Manage You (Event #1 of 3)
3/6/2025.description:
Kross's research on self control, emotion regulation, and social neuroscience is exemplary. His first bestseller, Chatter, explored the science of introspection, the conversations we have with ourselves, sometimes negative. He is quite skilled interpersonally, is observant, open, and wants to make a chnge in people's lives. We're here for that! Daniel Pink is one of his closest friends, so we're anticipating a robust conversation for this Zoom event.







 Links

3/7/2025.name: Business and Technology Club Fundraiser: Culver's of Lincolnshire
2025 Winter Play: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee
3/7/2025.description:
Step right up to the quirkiest competition in town! The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee is a hilarious musical comedy perfect for audiences of all ages.

Follow an eclectic group of six mid-pubescents as they compete for the ultimate spelling championship. Along the way, they'll share hilarious and touching glimpses into their home lives, tackle outrageous (and possibly made-up) words, and dodge the dreaded "ding" of elimination. With catchy songs, quick-witted humor, and lovable characters, this show guarantees an evening of laughter and fun.

Who will take home the trophy? Who will go home with a juice box? Find out in this unforgettable celebration of awkward adolescence and the unbreakable spirit of competition!

    

  Audience Advisory: Patriot Theatre Company rates this production PG.  

 LINKS 
 *  PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan  ( Mar. 7 @ 7 p.m.  |  Mar. 8 @ 2 p.m.  |  Mar. 8 @ 7 p.m.  |  Mar. 9 @ 2 p.m. )  
*  DOWNLOAD: Event Program

3/12/2025.name: CCC Presents: Sophomore Family College and Career Night
3/12/2025.description:
The College Career Center will hold its annual night for sophomore families at 7 p.m. on Wednesday, March 12th. The event will be in person in the PAC but can also be streamed live via Zoom:  https://zoom.us/j/91630430709 
The slides and recording for this presentation will be available on the CCC website within one week of the event for families unable to attend.

Post Secondary Counselors Sara Hanson and Dan Miller, and Career Exploration Specialist Ms. Jaime Travis will discuss:
 * What families can expect during their junior year as they embark on the college and career exploration process.
* Naviance, an online tool to assist Stevenson students with college planning.
* Career planning options, including internships, job shadowing, and more.
 
Students are strongly encouraged to attend with their parent(s) or guardian(s) and have their iPads ready to explore Naviance during the presentation.

  Families that would like   to request a copy of the slide deck in another language can reach out to    shs_CollegeCareer@d125.org   , or via phone at  (847) 415-4517  prior to Tuesday, March 4th.  


 We look forward to working with your family!

3/13/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: Transition to Young Adulthood:â€‹ Managing Stress and Assessing College Preparedness
3/13/2025.description:
Stevenson Families are invited to attend a webinar presented by Compass Health Center on how families can help their teens make the transition to young adulthood. The objectives for the discussion include:
 * Understand current mental health trends and common stressors as high school seniors transition into adulthood.
* Learn how to evaluate college preparedness and provide effective support that encourages independence without enabling.
* Recognize the concept of learned helplessness and how parents can help their children avoid or overcome it during this critical stage.
 
 LINKS 
 * Zoom Link:  d125-org.zoom.us/j/96128832678

3/17/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Me, But Better: The Science and Promise of Personality Change
3/17/2025.description:
Khazan is a health and science reporter, and her new book documents her year-long experiments into improving her "Big Five" personality traits (neuroticism, conscientiousness, agreeableness, openness to experience, and extroversion). A funny, insightful read. Her interlocutor, Maria Konnikova, is a force, too!

3/18/2025.name: Spring Orchestra Concert
3/18/2025.description:
The Spring Orchestra Concert is an exciting close to the Winter season, and a lively awakening of the Spring to come. The music featured will be upbeat and jaunty, with moments of peaceful mediation as we contemplate the end of snow and ice, and the return of flowers and sunshine. Each of our four performing ensembles will be featured at the 6:00 and 7:00 events, with tunes that are sure to get your feet tapping and your heart pounding!

Groups featured include Patriot, Symphonic, Concert, and Stevenson Orchestra students with conductors Enrique Vilaseco, Anthony Krempa, and Benjamin Voigt.

The Concert Orchestra students will be premiering a new commission by Chicago area composer Ahmed Al Abaca, completely put together from student submissions and inspirations!



 LINKS 
 *  DOWNLOAD: Event Program   
*  Streaming via Vimeo
3/18/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center

3/20/2025.name: CCC Presents: College and Career Center Night for Junior Families
3/20/2025.description:
All juniors and their parents/guardians are invited to the  College Career Center Series for Junior  Families. Our second night of the series is on Thursday, March 20th from 7 pm - 8 pm in the West Auditorium and streamed via Zoom Webinar:  https://zoom.us/j/93201457327 .

  Students are highly encouraged to attend this program with their families.  
 * Post Secondary Counselors Sara Hanson and Dan Miller will discuss:
* How Colleges Admit Students "Holistic" Admission Process
* Letters of Recommendation Essays
* Admission Plans
* Application Process & Timeline
 
The slides and recording for this presentation will be available on the CCC website within one week of the event for families who are unable to attend.

  Families that would like to request a copy of the slide deck in another language can reach out to    shs_CollegeCareer@d125.org   , or via phone at  (847) 415-4517  prior to     Thursday, March 13th.  

For more information, please visit the  Junior Focus web page .

4/8/2025.description:
Thrilled to see that long-time FAN fave  Doug Bolton  has written his first book bringing together all of the incredible knowledge and experience he has as a clinician and educator. Many of you know Doug, and know that he is the real deal -- so humane, so insightful. We've been connected to him forever, and are so glad to be his host for launch day of the book. Not to be missed!

4/9/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Dear Writer: Pep Talks & Practical Advice for the Creative Life
4/9/2025.description:
Maggie Smith  is back! She is just so excellent and warm and brilliant, and we can't wait to jump into this new book. This will be a great program for all those who write, or try to write, or are thinking about trying to write! We appreciate how Maggie breaks down creativity into ten elements, and then offers writing prompts for exploration. Great program for teens and young adults, too. We're lucky to have  Glory Edim  back to interview Maggie, too -- Glory is a dynamo, extremely charismatic, and is a fountain of advice herself.

4/15/2025.name: The AP and Advanced Art Show
4/15/2025.description:
The AP and Advanced Art Show exhibition will take place Tuesday April 15th and Wednesday April 16th in 2104 and the Upper Forum. The show is open to the school during periods 1-8 on Tuesday April 15th and periods 1-7 on Wednesday April 16th. The evening reception will take place on Tuesday April 15th from 7-9 pm.

The Show includes work from students enrolled in AP Art, AP Photography & Digital Design, as well as students enrolled in Advanced Photography & Digital Design. The Artwork on display is mature in nature.

The AP Art, AP and Advanced Photography & Digital Design students would greatly appreciate your attendance at their show!

-----------------

 AP Art: Drawing, 2D & 3D Design : Mackenzie Athanas, Dasha Balitska, Julia Beatty, Marin Bonilla, Philip Boyko, Nataly Cortes, Vicky Ferreira Key, Lyamai Garcia, Aania Gill, Charlie Gray, Raya Hamad, Victoria He, Camembert Jacobs, Pujita Jain, Insha Kittur, Lia Kosik, Minwoo Lee, Zini Li, Jasmine Liu, Madison Mayes, Mia Mihina, Gillian Rosen, Naomi Roytman, Nelli Sandor, Liv Sawyer, Ruihan Shi, Fiona Sirais, Lilly Sunny, Iuliana Veretennikova & Qi Zhang

4/16/2025.name: The AP and Advanced Art Show
4/16/2025.description:
The AP and Advanced Art Show exhibition will take place Tuesday April 15th and Wednesday April 16th in 2104 and the Upper Forum. The show is open to the school during periods 1-8 on Tuesday April 15th and periods 1-7 on Wednesday April 16th. The evening reception will take place on Tuesday April 15th from 7-9 pm.

The Show includes work from students enrolled in AP Art, AP Photography & Digital Design, as well as students enrolled in Advanced Photography & Digital Design. The Artwork on display is mature in nature.

The AP Art, AP and Advanced Photography & Digital Design students would greatly appreciate your attendance at their show!

-----------------

 AP Art: Drawing, 2D & 3D Design : Mackenzie Athanas, Dasha Balitska, Julia Beatty, Marin Bonilla, Philip Boyko, Nataly Cortes, Vicky Ferreira Key, Lyamai Garcia, Aania Gill, Charlie Gray, Raya Hamad, Victoria He, Camembert Jacobs, Pujita Jain, Insha Kittur, Lia Kosik, Minwoo Lee, Zini Li, Jasmine Liu, Madison Mayes, Mia Mihina, Gillian Rosen, Naomi Roytman, Nelli Sandor, Liv Sawyer, Ruihan Shi, Fiona Sirais, Lilly Sunny, Iuliana Veretennikova & Qi Zhang

4/16/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: What We Value: The Neuroscience of Choice and Change
4/16/2025.description:
Another in a series of incredible neuroscience-based programs for FAN -- our audience loves these!  Emily Falk  is an esteemed researcher at Penn, and she walks us through the process of how we make the "value calculations" that govern our decision-making. Her conversation partner, UMichigan's  Ethan Kross  (author of the 2021 international bestseller Chatter), will be doing his own FAN event(s) this winter for his new book Shift -- you'll be hearing about that soon! Please note the 12:00 PM CT start time for this event.

 LINKS 
 * Event Page: TBA
* Register via Zoom: TBA
* Emily's Book:  https://www.amazon.com/What-We-Value-Neuroscience-...

4/21/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Held Together: A Shared Memoir of Motherhood, Medicine, and Imperfect Love
4/21/2025.description:
FAN has had the pleasure of hosting several physician memoirists, and we always get a great turnout. For this book,  Rebecca Thompson  interweaves her own story of life-threatening pregnancy complications with 20+ narratives of patients, friends, and colleagues, all centered on the many paths to building and sustaining a family. Topics include adoption, infertility, fostering, surrogacy, loss, and stepparenting. 



 LINKS 
 * Event Page: TBA
* Register via Zoom: TBA
* Rebecca's Book:  https://www.rebeccanthompson.com/preorder

For more information, please visit the  ACT - PreACT - SAT Testing web page .



 *No classes for seniors and juniors

4/22/2025.name: Freshmen Wellness Day
4/22/2025.description:
While all the sophomores are taking their Pre-ACTs, all freshmen will spend a fun-filled day with SHS staff to explore the theme of "Live in Community!" Through a variety of activities, freshmen will grow their skills to:
 * Build character and a sense of confidence while appreciating the similarities and differences of others.
* Listen to others and communicate in ways that build empathy and respect.
* Understand what it means to be an effective ally when people are treated with disrespect or injustice.
* Establish and maintain supportive relationships in ways that foster learning.
4/22/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Patriot Wellness Center

4/22/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: What to Expect Sophomore Year
4/22/2025.description:
Join us for a discussion that focuses on what families can expect during their teen's Sophomore year. The discussion highlights milestones to watch for throughout the year. We will also discuss how families can support the growing independence of their teens.
 Zoom Discussion Link:  d125-org.zoom.us/j/97954394417

4/22/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Ordinary Magic: The Science of How We Can Achieve Big Change with Small Acts
4/22/2025.description:
Greg Walton  is a close collaborator with Carol Dweck (FAN '11, '14) and David Yeager (FAN '24), and his Ph.D. advisor was Geoff Cohen (FAN '22, '24). Walton and Cohen are the developers and researchers of the groundbreaking concept of "wise interventions." Walton has been on the FAN "get" list for a decade, and this book, focusing on the "ordinary magic" of wise interventions and how they can produce enormous gains, will be invaluable for schools, leaders, parents, and individuals.



 LINKS 
 * Event Page: TBA
* Register via Zoom: TBA
* Greg's Book:  https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/722986/or...

4/23/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: What to Expect Junior Year
4/23/2025.description:
Junior year is filled with a number of important milestones. Join us as we discuss how families can support their Junior at Stevenson. We will also discuss milestones to be aware of during Junior year.
 Zoom link to discussion:  d125-org.zoom.us/j/93289559423

4/24/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: What to Expect Senior Year
4/24/2025.description:
It seems like Seniors should be good to navigate the year independently, but there are several milestones families should be aware of, including the events, deadlines, and milestones families can anticipate during senior year.Zo Join us as we discuss routines families can begin during senior year to support their teen's independence.
 Zoom link to the discussion:  d125-org.zoom.us/j/98404061196

5/7/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: The Family Dynamic: A Journey into the Mystery of Sibling Success
5/7/2025.description:
Susan Dominus  is a college friend of hers. Say less! Dominus is at the top of her game at the Times, and The Family Dynamic is her first book, profiling families that have multiple successful children in various professions. She looks at both the stories and the science, debunks a few myths, and adds to the ongoing nature vs. nurture discussion.

5/12/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: The AI Con: How to Fight Big Tech's Hype and Create the Future We Want
5/12/2025.description:

5/15/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Unforgiving Places: The Unexpected Origins of American Gun Violence
5/15/2025.description:
Jens Ludwig 's work combines data science and behavioral science to address social problems. He works closely with schools, police departments, and mayors to design interventions that work. The Crime Lab received a MacArthur Award for Creative and Effective Institutions in 2014, the "genius grant" equivalent for organizations. Christian Mitchell is the VP for Civic Engagement at the U. of C., and is a former Deputy Governor of Illinois, overseeing myriad state agencies. He was a three-term state rep from Illinois' 26th District, spanning the lakefront from the Gold Coast to South Chicago.

 LINKS 
 * Event Page: TBA
* Register via Zoom: TBA
* Jens' Book:  https://press.uchicago.edu/ucp/books/book/chicago/...
